channel.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
channel.description:
Hey mopar, for the people that don't like that message, can you add a Get['agree'] on that page so that we can go to the forums using a bookmark without having to type anything in, but we would still be agreeing to the document.
Such as ...
http://www.moparisthebest.com/agreement.php?agree=yes
Would be much easier. :)

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

leader:

The agreement message pops up twice for me. First when I go onto this site and then after I put in my username and password it reappears. After I type “yes” again, I have to retype my username and password.

That is because you went from moparisthebest.com to moparisthebest.org I have now changed the forums to use both now.

Read full topic

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @Mmmk Mmmk
item.description:
@Mmmk wrote:

[quote=“Taylor, post:18, topic:19011”][quote author=Ron link=topic=28844.msg341417#msg341417 date=1161591268]

What could Jagex really do? We’re not doing anything illegal here.

Private servers are illegal. And we’re advocating it.
[/quote]i know, but running a private server forum isn’t illegal, only people running private servers is illegal ;)[/quote]
Neh, even that isnt. Only the client is, the servers are non jagex code.

Read full topic

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

How about you just use a checkbox to agree. This is what most sites use, and it makes more sense than typing ‘yes’.

Read full topic

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

keep the ToS, learn javascript injection if you would rather click a bookmark than type in yes ;D

if you want me to tell you what it is you need to bookmark, just pm me, Ron

Read full topic

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Mopar, I think that if jagex was going to try and take down the website, they would have gotten away with it by now. Have you had any legal threats yet? Or, for that matter any REAL legal threats? I bet a lot of noobs send you emails with their leet php hax to make it look like it’s coming from jagex. Kait said he used to get several of them a day.

Either way, typing yes isn’t too big of a deal at all. Ron, just clear your cookies less often? Or just stop looking at so much porn that you need to clear your cookies each day

Read full topic

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

moparisthebest:

The only thing I am worried about Ron, is the fact that it opens a way to view the website without first reading the TOS. Jagex may find this as a way to screw me. Can’t you just put an exception in for my cookie? or chmod it so that firefox doesn’t have the power to delete it? (or the windows equivalent of chmod, stupid windows :rolleyes:)

Im just wondering but what would happen if jagex finds this site without the TOS thing?
Will it be like shutdown or something, or are you going to get into some deep shit?

Read full topic

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The only thing I am worried about Ron, is the fact that it opens a way to view the website without first reading the TOS. Jagex may find this as a way to screw me. Can’t you just put an exception in for my cookie? or chmod it so that firefox doesn’t have the power to delete it? (or the windows equivalent of chmod, stupid windows :rolleyes:)

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I delete my cookies everytime I exit firefox. I hate cookies that expire in more than 20 seconds.

Yeah I wouldn’t be typing it in everytime. It would be bookmarked. Like right now moparisthebest.com/smf is bookmarked and I have firefox to automatically delete cookies everytime I exit the browser. And everytime people go to that address plus agree=yes, then they would automatically say that they agree to those terms everytime. This would just be a faster and much easier approach. It’s not bothering me that much, but on a scale of 1 to 10 (1 being not bothering me at all, and 10 being I would kill myself if I see that fuckin page again) I would give it a 6.

Just a request. So how about it Mopar, could you implement it for not just me but for everyone experiencing the same or higher magnitude of frustration?

Read full topic

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Well, they’ll have to deal ;D

Because, if someone who is pretty much supposed to see the TOS gets that link, then they’re either excempt or otherwise.

Read full topic

item.title: The annoying agreement - Small Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:8, topic:19011”][quote author=XxKanexX link=topic=28844.msg332841#msg332841 date=1161337108]

He’s saying that there should be a workaround it, so that you type in the url with a GET variable, basically just to bypass the screen if you often access this site from different computers. It does get a bit annoying at times like when I go up to the computer lab in my free time, for example, but it doesn’t bother me that much tbh.

Ok, that would be easy to do, but I still fail to see how it is easier to type “http://www.moparisthebest.org/agreement.php?action=agree” than to type “yes”

Then we could bookmark that page and go straight to the forums. Just makes it a tad bit easier.
[/quote]

But the cookie I set doesn’t expire for something like 600 days, so once every 600 days you have to retype yes, I still dont see how it would make it easier.[/quote]
People delete their cookies frequently, or have scanners that do so.

Read full topic
